metadata.name: Potential Persistence Via Powershell Search Order Hijacking - Task
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\svchost.exe') AND contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('-k netsvcs')) AND contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('-s schedule')) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -windowstyle hidden')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -w hidden')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -ep bypass')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -noni'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader
